newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria Post Bank has 9.35 bln levs net profit 96.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria Post Bank has 9.35 bln levs net profit 96.

text.p: The state-owned Bulgarian Post Bank (BPB) said on Wednesday it made 9.35 billion levs net profit last year after a 3.65 billion lev loss for 1995.
"An audit by Deloitte & Touche showed the bank had 9.35 billion levs net profit for 1996 out of a pre-tax profit of 12.04 billion levs," a BPB statement said.

The profit was a result mainly of net interest income of 13.8 billion levs against an income of 3.0 billion levs in 1995 and foreign exchange gains of 16 billion levs last year against a loss 273 of million levs the year before, figures showed. @
The BPB extended 674 company credits totalling 8.293 billion levs last year and 99.84 percent of them were regularly serviced.
The bank's total assets amounted to 103.4 billion levs at the end of 1996 against 90.7 billion levs a year earlier and the bank's net worth amounted to 11.03 billion levs.
Its total liabilites amounted to 92.4 billion levs at the end of last year against 93.8 billion levs the year before.
